item.title: IGN Fan Fest 2025: Fall Edition - where to watch, and what to expect
item.content:encoded:
Celebrity interviews, exclusive gameplay, trailers, and more.

Later today, IGN Fan Fest returns with a special Fall Edition of the event. Fans will be able to watch celebrity interviews, exclusive gameplay, trailers, and deep dives across movies, TV, games, and more during the one-day event, which will stream live on today (15th October) from 10am PT / 1pm ET / 6pm BST, with a countdown show kicking off one hour before.

You can watch IGN Fan Fest: Fall Edition on the following platforms:

  • IGN.com
  • IGN's YouTube
  • Steam
  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Twitch
  • VG247
  • GamesIndsutry.biz
  • Rock Paper Shotgun

At the show, you can expect dozens of exclusive game trailers, interviews with celebrities, and exclusive clips and reveals across games, movies, TV, and more. For all the details on how to tune into the event live, check out the info below: .

There will be more than 80 exclusive reveals in the main show beginning at 10am PT / 1pm ET / 6pm BST, with an additional 25 trailers, clips, and interviews in the countdown at 9am PT.

The event will include appearances from some of the biggest names in pop culture, including:

  • Keanu Reeves
  • Emma Stone
  • Aziz Ansari
  • Jesse Plemmons
  • Dan Trachtenberg
  • Andy and Barbara Muschietti
  • And more!

Further to that, there will be a massive line-up of big-name titles that will be coming IGN Fan Fest: Fall Edition 2025. These include:

MOVIES

  • Predator: Badlands
  • Frankenstein
  • Good Fortune
  • Now You See Me: Now You Don't
  • Bugonia
  • Chainsaw Man – The Movie: Reze Arc
  • Dust Bunny
  • Keeper
  • The Carpenter's Son

TV

  • The Witcher
  • Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell: Deathwatch
  • IT: Welcome to Derry
  • Chained Soldier
  • The Walking Dead: Daryl Dixon
  • Digimon Beatbreak from Toei Animation
  • The Last Frontier
  • The Mighty Nein

GAMES

  • A brand-new Dovetail Game
  • Scott Pilgrim EX
  • Where Winds Meet
  • Shark Dentist
  • The Outer Worlds 2
  • Jurassic World Evolution 3
  • WWE 2K25
  • Anno 117: Pax Romana
  • Denshattack!
  • Invincible VS
  • Battlestar Galactica: Scattered Hopes
  • Terminator 2D: No Fate
  • Spongebob Square Pants: Titans of the Tide
  • Squirrel with a Gun
  • Cult of the Lamb: Woolhaven
  • WH40K: Dark Heresy
  • Formula Legends DLC
  • Outbreak Island
  • WH40K: Rogue Trader
  • The Outlast Trials
  • Warframe
  • House Flipper Remastered Collection
  • Ember and Blade
  • Bladesong
  • A.I.L.A
  • Ambrosia Sky
  • Astrobotanica
  • Football Heroes League
  • Blind Descent
  • Bop It: The Video Game
  • CRKD
  • MARVEL Cosmic Invasion
  • Deadzone: Rogue
  • Star Trek™: Voyager® - Across the Unknown
  • Directive 8020
  • Dispatch
  • Forestrike
  • Goodnight Universe
  • Hela
  • JDM: Japanese Drift Master
  • Kaiju Cleaner Simulator
  • Kristala
  • Lunar Industries
  • Moldwasher
  • Mouse: PI for Hire
  • Nano Neighbors
  • NUTMEG!
  • Quarantine Zone
  • The Occultist
  • Rightfully, Beary Arms
  • Skopje '83
  • Sword of Justice
  • TerraTech Legion
  • Welcome to Brightville
  • The Lonesome Guild
  • Winter Survival

Eurogamer is owned by IGN parent company, IGN Entertainment.

item.title: New Final Fantasy Dissidia game officially revealed for mobile devices, set in modern day Tokyo
item.content:encoded:
Square Enix has officially announced its next Dissidia game in the Final Fantasy spin-off series, coming to mobile devices next year.

Dissidia Duellum Final Fantasy was teased yesterday and then officially revealed today, with sign ups for its closed beta test now open (but only in the US and Canada).

While the trailer only hints at expected gameplay, it will feature 3 vs 3 battles with teams aiming to defeat monsters and bosses before their rivals.

There will also be some form of Bravery system to allow characters to unleash their full power, and it's all set in modern day Tokyo featuring a wealth of stars from across the Final Fantasy series.

"A peaceful everyday life, visited by chaos," the trailer teases. "Those who arrived to confront the chaos were called 'Ghosts'."

Ability illustrations will also be drawn by popular artists, and players will be able to customise their warriors with different outfits

The game is coming to iOS and Android devices next year, with recruitment available for the closed beta test running until 28th October. The test will take place from 7th - 14th November on Android only.

The trailer ends with a tease of more characters set to join the game.

Creative producer on the game (and series veteran) Tetsuya Nomura shared a message about the game on social media, celebrating the long-running spin-off series.

"Duellum is the sixth installment in the series, and as you can see from the world setting and visuals, it is another aspirational title packed with many new undertakings and ways for the staff to challenge themselves," he said.

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

The last Dissidia game was Dissidia Final Fantasy Opera Omnia, also released for mobile devices. However this, along with many other mobile games, was shut down in February last year.

Square Enix also has a Dragon Quest mobile game on the way, in the form of roguelite RPG Dragon Quest Smash/Grow.

Related topics


https://www.eurogamer.net/new-final-fantasy-dissidia-game-officially-revealed-for-mobile-devices-set-in-modern-day-tokyo

item.title: Pokémon TCG Pocket updates will soon make completing your collection easier, as mobile game approaches first anniversary
item.content:encoded:
Share cards with friends.

Pokémon TCG Pocket is fast approaching its first anniversary, and to celebrate new updates are on the way that will make it easier to complete your collection.

Firstly, a new Share function will be added, which will allow players to give away cards to their friends. The feature will appear on the Social Hub screen, but only one card can be shared each day and only 1-4 diamond rarity cards will be shareable.

Secondly, the range of tradable cards is expanding to include two star rarity cards, as well as shiny 1-2 rarity cards. Further, cards from the most recent expansion will be tradable.

A third tweak will alter wonder picks so that cards not registered in your card dex will appear more often to be chosen.

These updates will collectively make completing your card collection a lot easier, and arrive following the most recent booster pack that repeated rare cards previously released.

While these updates have not been given a specific date, they're expected this month alongside the game's anniversary. It certainly feels like a closing chapter on its first year of availability.

A further update will allow players to obtain Flair automatically without consuming shinedust.

The Pokémon Company has also teased the next expansion will feature Mega Evolution Pokémon and is planned for the end of October.

Mega Evolutions are a key part of new spin-off game Pokémon Legends: Z-A, which is released this week.

Related topics


https://www.eurogamer.net/pokemon-tcg-pocket-updates-will-soon-make-completing-your-collection-easier-as-mobile-game-approaches-first-anniversary
